sentence.Network_en: Manipulated by a devil, named Vergil.
sentence.Network_cn: 被一个叫做Vergil的恶魔控制了.

sentence.Network_en: Vergil: I've come to retrieve my power. You can't handle it.
sentence.Network_cn: 维吉尔: 我来取回属于我的力量, 你驾驭不了它.

sentence.Network_en: Vergil: Leave me! I won't tell you a third time.
sentence.Network_cn: 维吉尔: 滚! 我不想说第三遍.

means.word_mean: 1. a Roman poet; author of the epic poem `Aeneid' (70-19 BC)

auth_sentence.content: Richard is then surrounded by enemy troops but Vergil only says he was killed 'fighting in the thickest of the press'.
auth_sentence.res_content: Richard is then surrounded by enemy troops but Vergil only says he was killed 'fighting in the thickest of the press'.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Richard is then surrounded by enemy troops but Vergil only says he was killed 'fighting in the thickest of the press'.

auth_sentence.content: The Bard drew on the chronicles of Edward Hall and Raphael Holinshed, which in turn relied on More and Vergil.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Bard drew on the chronicles of Edward Hall and Raphael Holinshed, which in turn relied on More and Vergil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Bard drew on the chronicles of Edward Hall and Raphael Holinshed, which in turn relied on More and Vergil.
